alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:31PM CDT until May 19 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 431 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Beaufort, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Franklin County, including the following locations... Lyon, Noser Mill and Leslie. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
